newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's PHIBOR rates fall across the board.
newsitem.headline: Manila's PHIBOR rates fall across the board.

text.p: The Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) fell in all maturities after the Central Bank cut its overnight rates by 0.25 percentage points.
The Central Bank announced at midday it was raising its overnight borrowing rate to 15 percent from 12.75 percent.

The Central Bank move was meant to protect the peso on fears of a spillover from Thailand's troubles. The resignation of Thai finance minister Amnuay Viravan is causing renewed weakness in Thailand's financial markets.
Banks will be adjusting their swap points in line with the increase in the Central Bank's overnight rate, traders said.
